misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm.
description: The use of the MD5 hash function is vulnerable to collisions, which can lead to security issues such as authentication bypass or tampering. It is recommended to use a more secure hash function such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.
recommendation: Replace the use of MD5 with a more secure hash function such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.
